intro: Ravensara gracilis, commonly known as the slender ravenwood, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Ravensara gracilis is known for its aromatic foliage and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in tropical climates and requires well-drained soil and partial shade.
